p: The HORRAD phase III trial randomised 432 men to ADT with or without local prostate radiotherapy. 39 In accordance with STAMPEDE, no significant difference in OS was observed between the two groups (median 45 months in experimental arm vs 43 months with ADT alone; HR 0.90 (95% CI 0.70 to 1.14); p=0.40), although there was a non-significant trend towards improved OS in the 160 patients with low volume metastatic disease treated with radiotherapy (HR 0.68, 95% CI 0.42 to 1.10). This study, however, was criticised for its lack of prespecified metastatic burden (including no knowledge of visceral disease) and potential underpowered sample size. 40 Both trials took place at a time when upfront systemic agents had not been fully introduced and thus the true ‘additive’ effect of local prostate radiotherapy in a contemporary cohort remains unclear. 2
